messages.message:
Gotcha. Here’s the post Paul that you were trying to get access to. If you could port that into the Docs that’d be great:


api-server runlocal now runs on Python 3

What does this mean for your local env?
1. Create a new virtual environment, located in a different directory than your Python 2 venv

2. python3 -m pip install -r tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/requirements_py3.txt

3. Use this Py 3 virtualenv when running api-server locally

If you ever need to go back to the Python 2 version of api-server, use:
make build runlocal-py2

As far as other servers go, I will discuss a migration plan in another post.

I’ve been writing a simple doc for Python 2 to Python 3 compatible replacements:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YxMHM6KoPgLDaUUUKtaC3ju5bxF8aXeGMVmXQK7INSc/edit#

In the near future, we will need to make sure we write fully compatible Py2 and Py3 code!
The "Setting up your dev environment" doc looks like it has already been updated to reflect that api-server is a Python 3 service. Glad to know I wasn't missing anything critical!
